query: I receive Attendance Allowance but my care needs have increased in Brighton-hove. Can the council provide additional financial support?

Purpose and approach Purpose 1.1 The purpose of this Policy is to clarify the process which Brighton & Hove City Council (the “Council”) will follow when considering the accommodation and care and support needs of residents within the community. This includes when the Council is responsible for funding care and accommodation in residential or nursing home care and complies with the Care Act 2014. Also included within scope of this policy are people living in their own homes and people who were previously self-funding their own care arrangements. 1.2 In summary, an assessment under the auspices of the Care Act 2014 will determine whether a person has eligible care and support needs. The assessment will include whether a person is eligible for care and support needs to be funded by the Council. The Council will listen and take account of the service user's preferences as to how those needs are met

care in their local area. Brighton & Hove City Council ran a data collection  exercise 
throughout June & July 2022 and included engagement events for Care Homes and Home

answer:
If your care needs have increased in Brighton & Hove, you may be eligible for additional financial support from the council, but it will depend on an assessment of your needs and financial situation.

- **Assessment for Eligibility**: Brighton & Hove City Council will conduct an assessment under the Care Act 2014 to determine if you have eligible care and support needs that the council can fund. This assessment will consider your current situation and preferences for how your needs should be met (Documents 1 and 2).

- **Financial Support Conditions**: While you are receiving Attendance Allowance, the council can provide additional financial support if you meet certain conditions. Specifically, if you have less than £3,000 in savings, you might qualify for a "hardship assessment," which could result in the council funding your care in full (Document 3).

- **Next Steps**: To explore additional support, you should contact Brighton & Hove City Council's adult social care services. You can reach them via email at accesspoint@brighton-hove.gov.uk or by phone at 01273 29 55 55 for assistance with the assessment process and to discuss your increased care needs.

For more detailed information, you can visit the council's website on adult social care policies: [Brighton & Hove Adult Social Care](https://www.brighton-hove.gov.uk/adult-social-care-hub/documents-adult-social-care/choice-policy-adult-social-care).
